skillTree.localised_description: A horse! A horse! An acceptable amount of florins for a horse!
Borgio has no time for being wounded by his enemies. Not even by forks.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +15% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Battle protects Her own.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Borgio has always cared for the needs of his troops, even the lowest mercs, and minded where they deployed them. Trust goes both ways.
Battles are a matter of applying force to the weakest point. The tougher the force, the louder the crack.

Mercenary hosts usually include powerful regiments with double pay and double the risks, once dubbed in Tilea "Duplicarii". The original meaning has gone lost, and the usual sense is now "You bunch of dog-botherers will better get it done, with what you cost me."

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Costly gear lent to the mercenary companies may be expensive, but it may save the day and the treasury afterwards.
Borgio knows the worth of a well-trained and well-protected force of versatile crossbowmen. Let Miragliano be known for a fearsome force of troops that can block well, fight well and shoot back!

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Pavise Crossbowmen and Militia Spearmen 
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Pavise Crossbowmen

Armour: +15 for Pavise Crossbowmen and Militia Spearmen

Missile strength: +15% for Pavise Crossbowmen

skillTree.localised_description: Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half-Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half-Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)
effects.icon: BUGGED FOR XP UNIT SETS, HAPPENS BY DEFAULT, INTENDED

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
This man has not gotten where he is now by being weak-minded.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Being known for actually paying one's hirelings - those that come back alive, anyway - pays off.
Personally seizing the means of production never felt better.
Improving infrastructure and rebuilding the war-ravaged regions is key to a prosperous economy.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -7% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Money must flow.
"I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

effects.description:
Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: A commander that allows his captains and troops to everything they can put their hands on is either irresponsible, well-adviced, criminally aggressive or all of the above.
"People say that the colour of magic is purple, white, red... I say it is gold. For all that lot."

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +5% for Wizards
	(local province)

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +10% for Wizards
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: This man can easily distinguish between an ancient elven magical sword of implacable might and a piece of shiny iron, which is not so simple when the artifact itself is in that disguise.
Sometimes it is just time to party. The louder, the better.
This commander has accrued a retinue of the sliest and shrewdest captains and guides available. Their advice is worth every silver coin.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "I shall wear midnight... and many knives."

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
Being supportive of the flourishing tilean art is prestigious, and prestige is lucrative.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
"You know you're doing it right when everyone and their mamas are sending people to stab you."
Knowledge that the enemy wallet might buy your troops out even before the first battle puts huge pressure to make sure it doesn't happen.
Commerce is the life-blood of any economy, and the sea must be its heart.

"Open the coffers, put up more signs. I want more cannons, pikes, even ogres, even those buggers with the paper wings. Everyone. I shall have that castle by tomorrow or by Myrmidia I will drown them in mercs."
Kill not, waste not.
Such is the pinnacle of the tilean merchant prince and politician that seemingly anything can be handled.

factionEffects.localised_description: Through innovative tactics and personal hard work, any fortification will be in Borgio's hands by snack time. Dinner, tops.

effects.description: Hardened Veterans: Strong Vigour, +5 Armour, +8%% Damage for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Leadership: +10 when laying siege or encircling

items.colour_text: Only some scholars might know what those statues were about, but once melted and used to forge this huge brazen armour, they might have brought over whatever enchantment they used to bear...

During the Siege of Remas, a cannonball flew straight at Borgio. Instead of rather influential smithereens, bystanders witnessed that the projectile was stuck right into the Prince's armour, who was barely wounded. Melted and reshaped as a mace, the cannonball makes for a terrifying and symbolic weapon.
During the most furious melees, Borgio wears his frightening mask, a grotesque grimace of malice. Coupled with the wearer's bulk and might, the effect is scary indeed.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: During the Siege of Remas, a cannonball flew straight at Borgio. Instead of rather influential smithereens, bystanders witnessed that the projectile was stuck right into the Prince's armour, who was barely wounded. Melted and reshaped as a mace, the cannonball makes for a terrifying and symbolic weapon.
During the most furious melees, Borgio wears his frightening mask, a grotesque grimace of malice. Coupled with the wearer's bulk and might, the effect is scary indeed.
Only some scholars might know what those statues were about, but once melted and used to forge this huge brazen armour, they might have brought over whatever enchantment they used to bear...
Most things simply do not stand for long when Borgio is set to conquer them.

effects.description:
Siege towers: +1 per siege item constructed
	(Lord's army)
Can recruit a second company of Braganza's Besiegers
